name: Mixed Bag 27 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: What class mail is parcel post?
questions.explanation:
4th.

	Parcel post is used when economy is most important. Packages can weigh up to 70 pounds and measure up to 130 inches in length and girth combined.

questions.text: What was the rank of World War 1 hero Alvin York?
questions.explanation:
Sergeant.

	Initially he was a conscientious objector but went on to be a Medal of Honor winner.

questions.text: What is the biggest grain crop of the United States?
questions.explanation:
Corn.

	It also ranks with wheat and rice as one of the world's chief grain crops.

questions.text: Which of the following came first?
questions.explanation:
Corset.

	Corsets appeared early in the Renaissance.

questions.text: On which Apollo planned mission did three astronauts lose their lives?
questions.explanation:
Apollo 1.

	This occured on January 27, 1967. The crew of three died of asphyxiation.

questions.text: In what country was Rudolph Valentino born?
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	He was born in Castellaneta, Italy in 1895, and arrived in New York in 1913.

questions.text: What was Milton Berle's theme song?
questions.explanation:
'Near You'.

	Uncle Miltie starred in th 'Texaco Star Theater' and was nicknamed Mister Television.

questions.text: What country was the birthplace of the Red Cross?
questions.explanation:
Switzerland.

	The initiative came from Swiss Philanthropist Jean Henri Dunant. The American Red Cross was founded in 1881 by Clara Barton and chartered by congress in 1900.

Sword.

	It is a samurai sword revered by its owner.

questions.text: Of the following, what is a greenbottle?
questions.explanation:
Fly.

	There are also copperbottle, bluebottle and black bow flies among others.
